page_analysis.text_content:
Porches & entry features

Facades with defined entryways make a streetscape pleasant and friendly as long as they are not out of scale or proportion.

The gross floor area regulations encourage appropriately sized porches and entryways.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.04.030(a)(113.1)
18.04.030(143.5)
18.12.040(b)table 3

Porch types

For purposes of assessing gross floor area, porches, entryways, and balconies fall into one of these categories:

1. Non-roofed porches, entryways, balconies etc.
  • Non-roofed features generally do not count

2. Roofed porches on the 1st floor (Fig 4 A & D on p. 7 , Fig 5 on p. 8)
  • Openess of the sides determines whether or not these count regardless of the height.
  • If they do count, they count only once.

3. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are less than 12' high (from grade) (Fig 4 B on p. 7)
  • These count once regardless of the design including openess.

4. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12' high from grade – "vaulted entry feature" (Fig 4 C & D on p. 7, Fig 6, 7, & 8 on pp. 11-13)
  • These count twice regardless of the design including openess.

5. Recessed porches on the 1st floor (Fig 9 on p. 14)
  • Height, depth, & openess determine whether or not these count.
  • If they count and are less than 17' high, they count only once.
  • If they count and are more than 17' high, they count twice.

6. Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors (Fig 10 on p. 15 )
  • These count once regardless of the design including openess

The following pages address the details of assessing these features with regard to gross floor area.

visual_elements.description: A grey vertical sidebar on the left side of the page containing the title 'Porches & entry features', a brief description about facades and gross floor area regulations, and a list of code sections.

A grey rectangular box on the right side of the page titled 'Difference between a porch & an entry feature:' explaining that a feature is considered a porch rather than an entry feature if it can clearly accommodate more activities than entering and leaving the house.

Height threshold for recessed porches counting once or twice

subheadings: Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are less than 12' high (from grade)

Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors

The page is well organized with a left sidebar, main text body, and a highlighted information box on the right.
